intro: Metalasia cymosa, commonly known as the clustered metalasia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are often pink or violet and bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Metalasia cymosa is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
